comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Per this T&CJ item, the statue of John Oxley was put in place in ca. July 1893...it was evidently the last of the Bridge Street twelve to be added - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71187214 ; see my comments re the statues and sources re dates added at www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/5401920179/ I think I've got the statues right...my sources on the locations involve a mix of 19th century and present day pics (which in a couple of cases don't show quite enough detail for me to be 100% sure)...I've assumed the statues haven't been moved from their original locations...please let me know if I've mixed any up and I will change the notes accordingly...Google cherry picker view would be useful here!

comment.author: 28307887@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] I note a date of 1695 on the photo, would this be correct? although I hardly think they would have added an incorrect date way back then...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/palmypaul] No, that is the plate number of the photographer.  It is about 1893 when the warehouse was built (see note top right).
